image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'How can you be childless': Kamala Harris' stepdaughter says she loves three parents
item.description: ​Ella Emhoff has now come out in the support of stepmother, vice president Kamala Harris in the 'childless cat ladies' row and questioned how can she be "childless" when there are "cutie pie kids" like Cole and herself. She cited her biological mother Kerstin Emhoff's statement issued earlier over the issue as she supporter her 'momala' Kamala.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 19th-century Baltic shipwreck loaded with champagne uncovered by Polish divers
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk's daughter reacts to 'killed by woke virus' jibe: 'I disowned him'
item.description: Vivian Jenna Wilson, Elon Musk's transgender daughter, Thursday reacted to father's recent statement that she has been "killed by the woke-mind virus" and said: 'I look pretty good for a dead bi***". Viviana did not post it on X, his father's company and chose Mark Zuckerberg's Threads to give it back to Elon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance's beard can make history if he's elected. Here's why
item.description: If Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance is elected as the vice president, then his beard will make history as White House has not seen any man with facial hair in recent past. Donald Trump apparently does not like facial hair but JD Vance's stubble does not irk him, it seems, as Trump complimented his running mate by saying that he looks like "young Abraham Lincoln".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hantavirus in US: Deadly rat disease kills four; health officials on alert
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: A year jail sentence should be given to anyone who desecrates American flag: Trump
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump suggested a one-year jail term for those desecrating the American flag after protesters burned flags in Washington, D.C. during Israeli PM Netanyahu’s speech. He urged Congress to implement strict penalties, dismissing concerns about constitutionality. House Republicans later replaced the burned flags.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris Baptist, husband Jewish; her faith traces back to Gandhi, MLK: 10 interesting facts
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris represents a fusion of traditions and teachings and has the best of the two worlds, her longtime pastor the Rev. Amos Brown, who leads Third Baptist Church in San Francisco said as Kamala embarks on her presidential election campaign. Kamala is deeply religious and had Brown on phone after President Joe Biden endorsed her for the presidential race. Everyone in her team is well-acquainted with Brown as he is always phone call away.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'When you have kids...': JD Vance's defence for what he feels for 'childless cat ladies'
item.description: ​JD Vance is in the center of a major controversy with prominent voiced adding their dissent to what the Republican VP candidate feels about 'childless cat ladies'. Videos have emerged of JD Vance saying he feels that people without child have less stake in the future and so they should not have the same voting rights as the people with children etc. He called Kamala Harris, AOC and Pete Buttigieg 'childless cat ladies' who are running the country.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Robber grandpas': Elderly trio charged with burglary in Japan
item.description: Three elderly men in Japan, with a combined age of 227, were arrested for a series of burglaries in Sapporo. They met in prison and stole cash, whiskey, and jewelry. They reportedly broke into an unoccupied house in Sapporo, Hokkaido, in May, stealing 200 yen (US$1.30) and three bottles of whisky valued at 10,000 yen (US$65). The men's motive was reportedly to 'make a living.'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Exploring Chinese numerology: Lucky numbers, car plates, wedding dates
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia offers 2 lakh rubles as signing bonus to fight Ukraine war
item.description: Russia offered financial incentives, including a 195,000 ruble signing bonus and monthly salaries up to 400,000 rubles, to attract new military recruits. The government also appealed to patriotism. This effort aims to counteract manpower shortages amidst ongoing military operations in Ukraine since February 2022.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Southwest Airlines to discontinue open seating policy
item.description: Southwest Airlines is ending its open seating policy after 50 years, shifting to assigned seating and premium rows. The company cites evolving customer preferences and the need to attract corporate travelers. This change follows pressure from Elliott Investment Management and reflects unsuccessful summer ticket sales affecting profits. Additionally, Southwest will introduce red-eye flights on five routes starting February to boost revenue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Deployment of UAE's Mirage fighters bombers in China raises concerns in US
item.description: The UAE Air Force and China's PLAAF held a joint exercise in Xinjiang, involving Mirage 2000-9 fighter bombers. The event raised US concerns about China getting access to Western military technology. It pointed to stronger UAE-China ties and significant geopolitical shifts. The UAE's inclining towards China had shown Washington about the UAE's level of independence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Catfight in US over childbearing and abortion as election campaign heats up
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Not only 'cat ladies', JD Vance once said childless people should not have....
item.description: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance's childless cat ladies comment targeting Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg and AOC has struck all the wrong chords as the Republican leader is facing a volley of criticism from all quarters -- Jennifer Anniston being the latest. Now another clip has emerged on social media highlighting JD Vance's stand on childless people.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Yes, Kamala Harris' first campaign video has Beyonce's 'Freedom'
item.description: Kamala Harris Thursday released the first video of her presidential campaign and it featured Beyonce's song Freedom. CNN earlier reported that Harris' team reached out to Beyonce to get approval to use that song throughout her presidential campaign. And it was allowed. Quickly.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jailed Imran Khan to run for Oxford University Chancellor post? Internet can't keep calm
item.description: Pakistan's former prime minister Imran Khan is reportedly planning to apply for the position of the chancellor at Oxford University after the post became vacant following the resignation of Lord Patten. Imran Khan is in jail on charges of inciting protests and violence against the military last year. Reports said Imran Khan's team cited public demand that he should contest but it will be a tough one as Boris Johnson, Tony Blair -- the former UK PMs -- are also in the race.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Climate protest at Frankfurt Airport forces a temporary halt to flights
item.description: Environmental activists disrupted air travel at Frankfurt Airport by breaching security fences, leading to the cancellation of over 100 flights. The demonstrations aimed to highlight the urgent need to address climate change caused by fossil fuel use. Similar protests occurred across Europe, targeting airports in Finland, Norway, Switzerland, and Spain. Legal actions were planned against the activists.

item.title: Why does Nepal suffer so many air crashes?
item.description: Eighteen people lost their lives in a Kathmandu plane crash, underscoring Nepal’s air safety issues. The country's difficult terrain, outdated aircraft, and inadequate pilot training contribute to frequent incidents. Although the European Union had banned Nepal's airlines since 2013, improvements in aviation regulation have been observed recently.

item.title: Putin vows 'retribution' against those trying to 'divide' Russia
item.description: Putin has escalated a decades-long crackdown on civil society, independent media and opposition amid his military offensive in Ukraine, with dissent and criticism of the Kremlin outlawed and punishable by years-long prison sentences.
